user.title: Configure Action Result
user.description:
Configure a sensor that exposes the response from a Home Assistant service call.

Select and configure a service action using the visual editor below.

data_description.name: A friendly name for this sensor (e.g., 'Tibber Prices')
data_description.service_action: Select the service/action to call and configure its parameters. Use 'Show YAML' to paste or edit YAML directly.

device_selection.title: Parent Device (Optional)
device_selection.description:
Optionally associate this sensor with a device from the selected action's integration.

**This is completely optional.** You can leave this empty to create a standalone sensor. If left empty, a virtual device will be created automatically.

If a device was selected in the action configuration, it will be pre-selected here.

data_description.parent_device: Select a device or leave empty for a standalone sensor with auto-generated virtual device.

sensor_type.title: Choose Sensor Type
sensor_type.description: Select the type of sensor to create.

menu_options.data_sensor: Data Sensor - Full response in attributes
menu_options.value_sensor: Value Sensor - Extract specific value as state

data_sensor.title: Data Sensor Selected
data_sensor.description: Creating a Data Sensor that exposes the full response data in attributes. The sensor state will show the call status (ok/error).

value_sensor.title: Value Sensor Selected
value_sensor.description: Creating a Value Sensor that extracts a specific value from the response and uses it as the sensor state.

data_settings.title: Data Sensor Settings
data_settings.description: Configure how response data is exposed in sensor attributes.

data_description.response_data_path: Optional path to extract data from the response (e.g., 'results.0.items'). Leave empty for full response.
data_description.attribute_name: Name of the attribute that will contain the response data. Default is 'data'.

value_settings.title: Value Sensor Settings
value_settings.description:
Configure which value to extract from the response and how to interpret it.

For boolean values, a binary sensor will be created automatically.

data_description.response_data_path: Path to the value in the response (e.g., 'temperature' or 'data.items[0].value'). Required.
data_description.value_type: How to interpret the extracted value: Text, Number, Boolean, or Timestamp.
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Optional unit (e.g., '°C', 'kWh', '€/kWh'). Only for numeric values. Leave empty for auto-detection or no unit.
data_description.device_class: Optional device class (e.g., 'temperature', 'energy', 'monetary'). Leave empty for auto-detection.
data_description.include_response_data: Also include the extracted response data in sensor attributes for context.

value_path.title: Value Sensor Path Configuration
value_path.description: Specify the path to extract the sensor value from the action response.

data_description.response_data_path: Path to extract the sensor value (e.g., 'results.0.temperature'). Required.
data_description.response_data_path_attributes: Optional: Different path for attributes (e.g., 'results.0'). Leave empty to use value path.
data_description.include_response_data: Include the full action response in sensor attributes.
data_description.attribute_name: Name of the attribute that will contain the response data (only used if 'Include Full Response' is enabled). Default is 'data'.

value_configuration.title: Value Sensor Configuration
value_configuration.description: Configure the value type, unit, and device class. Auto-detected from the action response.

data_description.value_type: Type of the sensor value: String, Number, Boolean, or Timestamp.
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Unit of measurement for the value (e.g., '°C', 'kWh'). Leave empty for none.
data_description.device_class: Device class for proper display and history handling (e.g., 'temperature', 'energy'). Leave empty for none.
data_description.icon: Custom icon for this sensor (e.g., 'mdi:thermometer'). Leave empty to use the default 'mdi:api'.
data_description.entity_category: Optional: Mark this value sensor as Diagnostic (hidden from cloud/voice assistants). Leave empty for regular sensor. Note: Data sensors are always diagnostic.

composite_unit.title: Build Custom Composite Unit
composite_unit.description:
Build a custom composite unit by selecting a numerator and denominator (e.g., '€/kWh', 'km/h').

Both dropdowns support freetext input for maximum flexibility.

data_description.unit_numerator: The unit in the numerator position (e.g., '€', 'km', 'ct'). Select from dropdown or enter custom text.
data_description.unit_denominator: The unit in the denominator position (e.g., 'kWh', 'h', 'Wh'). Select from dropdown or enter custom text.

enum_definition.title: Define Enum Values (Optional)
enum_definition.description:
For text sensors, you can optionally define a list of possible values (enum). This allows you to assign icons and translations to each value.

**Note:** You don't need to know all possible values upfront. If the sensor encounters a new value, it will be automatically added to the configuration. You'll receive a notification to add translations for new values.

data_description.define_enum: Enable this to define possible values for this text sensor.
data_description.enum_values: Enter known values separated by commas (e.g., 'sunny,cloudy,rainy'). New values will be automatically added when discovered.

enum_icons.title: Enum Icons
enum_icons.description: Assign an icon to each enum value. Icons will change automatically based on the sensor's state.

enum_translation_languages.title: Translation Languages
enum_translation_languages.description: Select which languages you want to translate the enum values into. English is always included and will be configured in the next step.

data_description.enum_translation_languages: Select additional languages for translations. English will be configured first.

enum_translation.title: Enum Translations: {language}
enum_translation.description: Provide translations for each enum value in {language}. These translations will be available in sensor attributes.

update_mode.title: Choose Update Mode
update_mode.description: Select how the service should be called to update the sensor.

menu_options.state_trigger_mode: State Trigger - Update when entity changes

polling_mode.title: Polling Mode Selected
polling_mode.description: The sensor will automatically update at regular intervals.

state_trigger_mode.title: State Trigger Mode Selected
state_trigger_mode.description: The sensor will update when a watched entity changes state.

manual_mode.title: Manual Mode Selected
manual_mode.description: The sensor will only update when manually triggered via the homeassistant.update_entity action.

polling_settings.title: Polling Settings
polling_settings.description: Configure the polling interval for automatic updates.

data_description.scan_interval: How often to call the action in seconds. Minimum 10 seconds.

data_description.response_data_path: Optional path to extract data from the response (e.g., 'results.0.items'). Leave empty for full response.

state_trigger_settings.title: State Trigger Settings
state_trigger_settings.description: Configure which entity state changes should trigger an update.

data_description.trigger_entity: Entity to watch for state changes.
data_description.trigger_from_state: Only trigger when changing from this state (optional). Leave empty for any previous state.
data_description.trigger_to_state: Only trigger when changing to this state (optional). Leave empty for any new state.

data_description.response_data_path: Optional path to extract data from the response (e.g., 'results.0.items'). Leave empty for full response.

manual_settings.title: Manual Update Settings
manual_settings.description: Note: The sensor will only update when you call the `homeassistant.update_entity` action.

data_description.response_data_path: Optional path to extract data from the response (e.g., 'results.0.items'). Leave empty for full response.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Service Action
reconfigure.description:
Update the service action configuration for this sensor.

To rename this entry, use Settings → Devices & Actions → [entry] → three-dot menu → Rename.

To change update mode (polling, manual, state trigger), use the Options flow instead.

data_description.service_action: Select the service/action to call and configure its parameters. Use 'Show YAML' to paste or edit YAML directly.

reconfigure_device_selection.title: Parent Device (Optional)
reconfigure_device_selection.description:
Optionally associate this sensor with a device from the selected action's integration.

**This is completely optional.** You can leave this empty to keep the sensor as is.

data_description.parent_device: Select a device or leave empty. Empty = keep current device association.

reconfigure_data_settings.title: Data Sensor Settings
reconfigure_data_settings.description: Configure how response data is stored in attributes.

data_description.response_data_path: Optional path to extract data from the response (e.g., 'results.0.items'). Leave empty for full response.
data_description.attribute_name: Name of the attribute that will contain the response data. Default is 'data'.

reconfigure_value_path.title: Value Path Configuration
reconfigure_value_path.description: Configure the path to extract the sensor value from the service response.

data_description.response_data_path: Path to the value in the response (e.g., 'temperature' or 'sensors.0.value'). Leave empty for entire response.
data_description.response_data_path_attributes: Optional: Path to extract additional attributes (e.g., 'metadata'). Leave empty to skip attributes extraction.
data_description.include_response_data: Include full response data as attribute (in addition to the extracted value).
data_description.attribute_name: Name of the attribute for full response data. Only used if 'Include Full Response' is enabled.

reconfigure_value_configuration.title: Value Configuration
reconfigure_value_configuration.description: Configure the value type, unit of measurement, device class, and icon.

data_description.value_type: The type of value this sensor will report (number, string, boolean, etc.).
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Optional: Unit of measurement (e.g., °C, %, W). Use dropdown for common units or enter custom unit.
data_description.device_class: Optional: Device class for better UI representation (temperature, humidity, power, etc.).
data_description.icon: Optional: MDI icon to display (e.g., mdi:thermometer). Leave empty to use device class default.
data_description.entity_category: Optional: Mark this value sensor as Diagnostic. Leave empty for regular sensor.

reconfigure_enum_definition.title: Enum Definition (Optional)
reconfigure_enum_definition.description:
Define a list of valid values for string sensors.

**Automatic value learning:** If the sensor receives a value not in this list, it will be automatically added and you'll receive a notification to add translations.

This provides dropdown selection in dashboards and proper localization.

data_description.define_enum: Enable if this sensor should have a limited set of possible values (e.g., states, modes).
data_description.enum_values: Comma-separated list of possible values (e.g., 'on,off,auto' or 'sunny,cloudy,rainy'). Values are automatically discovered if not initially known.

reconfigure_enum_icons.title: Enum Icons (Optional)
reconfigure_enum_icons.description: Assign Material Design Icons (MDI) to each enum value for better visual representation in the UI.

data_description.[enum_value]: MDI icon for this value (e.g., mdi:weather-sunny). Leave empty to use default.

reconfigure_enum_translation_languages.title: Enum Translation Languages
reconfigure_enum_translation_languages.description:
Select which languages you want to provide translations for.

Translations allow the sensor to display localized state values in the Home Assistant UI.

data_description.enum_translation_languages: Select one or more languages. You'll be able to enter translations for each enum value in the next step.

reconfigure_enum_translation.title: Enum Translations: {language}
reconfigure_enum_translation.description:
Enter translations for each enum value in {language}.

These translations will be displayed in the Home Assistant UI when the language is set to {language}.

progress.reconfigure_successful: Configuration updated successfully. The sensor will restart with the new settings.

init.description: Adjust the polling interval. To change the action configuration, use Reconfigure instead.

data_description.scan_interval: How often to call the action in seconds. Minimum 10 seconds.

yaml_parse_error.message: Failed to parse service action data YAML: {error}

service_not_found.message: The configured action "{service}" was not found. The integration may have been removed or is not loaded.

service_temporarily_unavailable.message: Action "{service}" is temporarily unavailable. Will retry automatically.

response_path_invalid.message: The configured response path "{path}" does not exist in the action response.

service_not_found.title: Service {service} not found for {name}
service_not_found.description:
The service `{service}` could not be found. This usually means:

- The integration providing the service is not installed or not loaded
- The service name has changed
- The service was removed

**To fix this:**
1. Check if the integration providing `{service}` is installed and enabled
2. Reconfigure this entry with a different service
3. Delete this entry if the service is no longer available

service_call_failed.title: Service call failed for {name}
service_call_failed.description:
Calling service `{service}` failed persistently: {error}

**To fix this:**
1. Check the service configuration and parameters
2. Verify the service is working correctly (test it manually)
3. Reconfigure this entry with corrected parameters
4. Check the integration logs for more details

trigger_entity_missing.title: Trigger entity missing for {entry_name}
trigger_entity_missing.description:
The trigger entity `{trigger_entity}` is no longer available. The integration is configured to update when this entity changes state, but it cannot be found.

This may be because:
- The entity was deleted
- The integration providing the entity was removed or disabled
- The entity ID was changed

**To fix this:**
1. Check if the entity `{trigger_entity}` exists in your system
2. Reconfigure this entry with a different trigger entity via the options flow
3. Or change the update mode to polling or manual

enum_value_added.title: New enum value discovered for {sensor_name}
enum_value_added.description:
The sensor `{sensor_name}` encountered a new value `{new_value}` that wasn't in the configured list of possible values.

The value has been automatically added to the configuration, but **translations are missing**.

**To add translations:**
1. Go to Settings → Devices & Services
2. Find Action Result Entities integration
3. Click on the sensor entry
4. Click 'Reconfigure' (currently not available - use YAML for now)
5. Add translations for the new value `{new_value}` in your preferred languages

**Note:** The sensor will continue working with the new value. This notification is just to remind you to add proper translations for a better user experience.
